snippet: What makes anti-Mormonism still appealing today is what made it appealing during the antebellum period: it makes other people feel good.
abstract: Op-Ed article by history Prof J Spencer Fluhman explores the roots of anti-Mormonism in American society, in light of the fact that Mitt Romney's presidential candidacy has provided the latest opportunity for stereotypes about Mormons to be aired.
lead_paragraph: What makes anti-Mormonism still appealing today is what made it appealing during the antebellum period: it makes other people feel good.
